abstracts.cdata!:
The Integrated Drug Prevention Pilot
            Project seeks to test the applicability of a multisectoral
            drug prevention strategy in the Argentine context. There are
            three project components. 1) Participatory approaches to
            drug prevention will promote local solutions to drug use in
            selected municipalities on a pilot basis via training local
            community members and sector professionals; training youth
            leaders; and financing the implementation of the municipal
            plans for drug prevention. 2) Information systems,
            monitoring, and evaluation will establish the network to
            facilitate generation and exchange of information relevant
            to drug prevention, as well as to carry out the monitoring
            and evaluation of the project by means of a) a survey-based
            epidemiological study to obtain information on drug
            consumption patterns; b) development of prevention methods
            and training modules that will be disseminated via national,
            regional, and provincial workshops; c) creation of a network
            of monitoring centers to strengthen existing institutions
            focused on drug prevention; and d) monitoring and evaluation
            of overall project implementation processes. 3) Project
            management will set up a project implementation unit.
